required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating TJ210001 in the Treatment of Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, MTD or MAD, PK, PD, and Antitumor Activity of TJ210001(a Fully Human C5aR Monoclonal Antibody) in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: A phase I clinical study evaluating TJ210001 in the treatment of subjects with advanced solid tumors

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a phase I clinical study evaluating TJ210001 monotherapy in patients with advanced solid tumors in dose escalation. The overall design of the study is shown in the figure below. The purpose of the TJ210001 single-dose escalation study in subjects with advanced solid tumors is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of monotherapy to determine the MTD (or MAD) and clinically recommended doses of TJ210001 monotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate and Severity of Dose-limiting toxicity （DLT）
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 28 days after last dose of study drug

intervention.description: The test drug TJ210001 will be preset with 5 escalation dose levels: 0.3mg/kg, 1mg/kg, 3mg/kg, 10mg/kg and 15mg/kg, administered once a week.
